name: Sauna / Heat Therapy

name: Red/NIR Light Therapy (Photobiomodulation)
mechanism: 630–670nm (red) and 810–850nm (near-infrared) wavelengths penetrate tissue; enhance cytochrome c oxidase in mitochondrial Complex IV → increased ATP production; reduced ROS; nitric oxide release; BDNF upregulation
dosageOrProtocol: 10–20 min/day; device 6–12 inches from target area; for brain: apply to forehead, temples, and base of skull
timingAdministration: AM or midday; NOT before bed (stimulating); daily or 5x/week
onset: 1–2 weeks for energy/mood; 4–8 weeks for structural neuroprotection
synergies: Methylene Blue (photo-activated by red light — combination is synergistic)

name: tDCS (Transcranial Direct Current Stimulation)
mechanism: Low-amplitude direct current (1–2mA) through scalp electrodes; modulates neuronal resting membrane potential — anodal stimulation increases excitability, cathodal decreases it; enhances LTP (long-term potentiation)
dosageOrProtocol: 1–2mA for 20 min; electrode placement depends on target function (e.g., F3 anode for working memory, left DLPFC for executive function)
timingAdministration: During cognitive task or learning session for maximum benefit; 3–5x/week
synergies: Active learning during stimulation (critical — tDCS enhances whatever the brain is doing)
warnings: Electrode placement is CRITICAL — wrong montage = wrong results or no results
consumer devices available (The Brain Stimulator, Apex)
research supports enhanced learning rate (not raw intelligence)
more effective when COMBINED with the target task
some military/athletic organizations use for training acceleration

name: Neurofeedback
mechanism: EEG-based real-time feedback trains self-regulation of brainwave patterns; operant conditioning of neural oscillations (alpha, beta, theta, SMR, gamma)
dosageOrProtocol: 20–40 min sessions; 20–40 sessions for lasting effects; protocols vary by goal
timingAdministration: 2–3x/week with practitioner; or at-home devices (Muse, Neurofeedback Pro)
onset: Gradual over 10–40 sessions; some acute effects
warnings: Infra-Low Frequency (ILF) neurofeedback and LENS are advanced protocols
clinical-grade neurofeedback requires trained practitioner with QEEG (brain mapping)
home devices (Muse, Focus@Will) provide basic training
well-established evidence for ADHD (comparable to medication in some studies)
alpha/theta training for creativity and relaxation

mechanism: Upregulates BDNF (neurogenesis); increases hippocampal volume; enhances cerebral blood flow; reduces beta-amyloid plaques and tau tangles; improves insulin sensitivity; increases synaptic plasticity; releases endorphins, endocannabinoids

name: Intermittent Fasting (16:8 or OMAD)
mechanism: Triggers autophagy (cellular cleanup); elevates BDNF; promotes ketone body production (BHB — alternative brain fuel that bypasses declining glucose metabolism in aging); enhances AMPK; improves insulin sensitivity
dosageOrProtocol: 16:8 (16h fast/8h eating window); or 18:6; or OMAD (one meal a day); 24–36h extended fasts monthly for deeper autophagy
timingAdministration: Skip breakfast or dinner; eating window typically noon–8PM; black coffee/tea allowed during fast
onset: Acute ketosis/clarity within 1–2 weeks of adaptation; autophagy increases significantly after 16+ hours
synergies: MCT oil (in morning coffee for ketone boost without breaking fat-burning)

cycling.guidance: Daily practice; extended fasts cycled monthly

warnings: The "mental clarity while fasting" phenomenon is real — ketone bodies (BHB specifically) are a super-fuel for the brain, producing more ATP per oxygen molecule than glucose
aging brains become increasingly insulin resistant — ketones bypass this entirely
the first 1–2 weeks of adaptation can involve brain fog (electrolytes help)
not appropriate for everyone (eating disorders, underweight, certain medical conditions)

all free, require no equipment

name: Sleep Optimization
mechanism: Consolidates memory (hippocampal replay); clears metabolic waste via glymphatic system (requires deep sleep); regulates hormones (GH, cortisol, testosterone); repairs neurons; integrates learning
dosageOrProtocol: 7–9 hours; prioritize consistency (same bed/wake time ±30 min); optimize sleep architecture (deep + REM)
timingAdministration: Cool room (65–68°F); dark (blackout curtains/eye mask); no screens 1h before bed; consistent schedule
onset: Immediate benefits from first improved night; cumulative over weeks
warnings: Sleep is not a supplement — it's the FOUNDATION everything else builds on
you cannot out-supplement bad sleep
the glymphatic system (brain's waste clearance) is 60% more active during deep sleep — this is when amyloid-beta is cleared
sleep deprivation impairs cognition MORE than alcohol intoxication
tracking (Oura, WHOOP, Eight Sleep) provides data for optimization
mouth taping forces nasal breathing (better oxygenation, deeper sleep)
